meanings.definition: The central and most important part of an object, movement, or group.
meanings.sent1: In a beehive, the queen bee is the nucleus of the colony.
meanings.sent2: The nucleus of a cell controls its functions.
meanings.sent3: The family picnic was a success, with Grandma at the nucleus of all the fun.
meanings.sent4: Her contagious laughter was the nucleus that brought the whole room together.
meanings.sent5: The bright red flag served as the nucleus for the marching band to follow.

meanings.definition: The positively charged central core of an atom, consisting of protons and neutrons.
meanings.sent1: The nucleus of an atom contains protons and neutrons.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the nucleus of atoms to understand their structure.
meanings.sent3: The tiny nucleus of the atom was like a bustling city with protons and neutrons as its residents.
meanings.sent4: The nucleus of the atom held the key to unlocking its mysteries.
meanings.sent5: The nucleus of the atom was like a tightly knit family, with protons and neutrons working together.

meanings.definition: A specialized structure within a cell that contains genetic material.
meanings.sent1: The nucleus of a cell stores genetic information.
meanings.sent2: Cells rely on the nucleus to carry out important functions.
meanings.sent3: The nucleus of the cell was like a library full of genetic books.
meanings.sent4: The nucleus of the cell was the treasure chest of genetic secrets.
meanings.sent5: The nucleus of the cell was the brain controlling all cellular activities.
